data.name: The Price is nice
data.description:
Everybody know the problem:

Your salesmanager come to you and say "Oh, recently on the toilet, i've got a great idea. Our new price for our new product is 7.90 $ incl. VAT". Now you're an intelligent Programmer and know, this price would produce problems if you'll calculate it to an net price.

```
7.90 $ / 1.0889 = 7.255 $ = 7.26 $

7.26 $ * 1.0889 = 7.905 $ = 7.91 $ <= Ehhhh, you failed!
```

The goal is:
Write an algorhytmus, which rounds +-1 penny to ten (see example above).
If the price is lower than 5 $, round additionally +-1 cent from fifth to next fifth ( ex. 3,04 $ => 3,05 $ ).
If the price lower than 2 $ do nothing.

## NOTE !
Floating numbers may inaccurate. Use Integers while calculation and then divide by 100. ;-)

Have fun :-)
